description.@en: With a ‘snap’ of your fingers, you can make an object appear to be of greater value than it truly is.

criticalFailure.@en: As you gently sprinkle the pyrite, three objects appear to become something incredibly valuable. However, within a few moments they disintegrate, forever destroyed.

criticalSuccess.@en: As above, but you can affect three objects instead.

effect.@en: After successfully casting this spell, the object you touch can appear to be far more valuable than it really is. For instance, you can turn a penny into gold, make a wooden staff appear as if made from ironwood or make a teetering wagon look like a shimmering crystal cart. Once affected, the object appears to be worth three times its original market value. Objects affected by Fool’s Fortune cannot be discerned to be false by normal means.

reagents.@en: A handful of pyrite, sprinkled over the object (expended)
